revised_title: Resonance Phenomena in Fluorine Disintegration by Protons
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the resonance phenomena in the disintegration of fluorine by protons. They discovered that the emission of y-rays and alpha particles from the excited 20Ne nucleus shows sharp resonances, confirming the mechanism responsible for the extreme sharpness of the observed resonance levels. The results provide strong evidence for the emission of a single excited state of 160 after the compound nucleus 20Ne* emits an alpha-particle of low energy.
